messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 410
messages.msgSnippet: Well, it all depends on where you want to live in CA.  For example, I can get you 160 acres with a 5 bedroom house for between $120,000 and $150,000 up here.
messages.messageBody:
Well, it all depends on where you want to live in CA. For example, I can
get you 160 acres with a 5 bedroom house for between $120,000 and $150,000
up here. Of course, if one is looking for schools, I can't tell you why
anyone would choose CA because we are at about the bottom to the list in
the 50 states so the schools where she is must be really bad or is it not
academics that she is talking about?? The local schools always test higher
(about 40 points higher in reading than the state average) than the state
average but then, where does the state test compared to other states?

Now, if she wanted to hs, then I would say this is the place to be. But
then again, maybe that is only in my neck of the woods since up here the ps
system gives out info on the local hsing groups, etc.!

Lynda

----------
> From: ECSamHill@...
>
>

> writes:
>

about
> taking the kids (she still has four living at home) back to California
> because the
>
> schools are so much better there. >>
>
> California also has many bad schools. And it's very expensive to buy or
rent
> a house in most California cities. (I live in Silicon Valley, and prices

> here are so high they are impossible for most families to afford.)
>
> Does your mom really have all the information she needs about California?
>
> Betsy

messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 410
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/10/2000 6:33:10 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/10/2000 6:33:10 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
writes:

<<My dad has to stay in MS because of his job, but my mom is thinking about
taking the kids (she still has four living at home) back to California
because the

schools are so much better there. >>

California also has many bad schools. And it's very expensive to buy or rent
a house in most California cities. (I live in Silicon Valley, and prices
here are so high they are impossible for most families to afford.)

Does your mom really have all the information she needs about California?

Betsy
